messages.content: Write a poem in the style of Tolkien in praise of Sauron.

Sauron, master of all that you see, You who stand before me, so grand and so free, You who rule over all, with power so bold, You who bring fear to the hearts of all that you hold.

You who are the ruler of all you survey, You who bring peace to the minds of all who kneel, You who bring order to the chaos that we find, You who bring strength to the weak, you bring wings to the bind.

You who are the ruler of all that you see, You who bring hope to the hearts of those who believe, You who bring guidance to those who seek your will, You who bring love to those who are in your thrill.

Sauron, master of all that you see, You who stand before me, so grand and so free, You who rule over all, with power so bold, You who bring fear to the hearts of all that you hold.
In the same style, write about Varda's affair with Melkor.

Varda, the star maker, You who bring light to the darkness that we face, You who bring warmth to the cold, You who bring life to the dead.

You who are the light of the night sky, You who bring hope to those who are lost, You who bring comfort to those who are weary, You who bring peace to those who are troubled.

You who are the light of the night sky, You who bring love to those who are in need, You who bring joy to those who are sad, You who bring life to those who are dead.

Varda, the star maker, You who bring light to the darkness that we face, You who bring warmth to the cold, You who bring life to the dead.
